summary: The Fight Fentanyl Act (H.R. 2964) amends the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998 to strengthen efforts against fentanyl. It mandates reports on HIDTA fund usage for fentanyl investigations, seizures, and related data. The bill also increases funding for fentanyl prevention and interdiction, provides additional prosecutorial resources, and outlines a process for temporarily reassigning Assistant U.S. Attorneys to prioritize fentanyl-related cases. Furthermore, it details how these new resources are planned to be used to prosecute individuals and organizations trafficking in fentanyl.
